column5: Hi Folks, any general guidance or feedback would be most appreciated.  Thanks.  SS.
I'll second what Dawg said !  If you are serious though...Leah's brother-in-law is one of the slims that sells that stuff.
I'm looking at some resales on the bay. Otherwise, their prices are INSANE!

PM me SS as to which place specifically and I'll do some askin tonight. I think he's already moved to Vegas to sell down there ...my sister-in-law is following in a month with the kids. Gonna miss her...him..well...   I'm still ticked he turned down Dominion Republic!
Thanks Irishfield - PM is on the way. This is much more helpful than the pollution that often blows up here from the south. I searched for the DAIBFN to return the favour, but to no avail....

would avoid it like the plauge Sheriff-bought 2 weeks at Carriage Hills in Barrie to trade for other locations--can never go to where i want to go when i want to go--terrible investment!  Cheers  icedude
I knew someone that bought a time share in the Canary Islands.  Sucker, he could never enjoy it at his convienience.  Also couldn't get out of it either.

SS Own 5 weeks that I paid significantly less for than one week from a Developer. Best thing I ever did! Staying at a 3 bedroom (sleeps 12) at Orange Lake (right beside Disney) for a month this coming January. Typical of the resorts I stay at! You need to know how to work the system. Check out www.tug2.net  Great timeshare owners site with tons of great info. Good Luck!
BPS - thanks for the link, I'll do some reading!   SS.
BTW, SS, he was there but in a meeting. Try him again later today.

My folks have the timeshare at Carriage Hills (they enjoy golfing).  I would have to say like anything else in a sharing system, you have to put in the effort and plan ahead.  My family has gone all over the world using the various timeshares.  For the most part, the gold crown properties are 5 star wherever you go.  The best part about the suites is that you just need to bring yourself and food, everything else is provided, kinda handy that way.  It's worth it, as long as you understand you can't call on a thursday before a long weekend and expect to find a lot of availability...  Tony
